item.title: Persona 5 Royal - Finish 'Em Trailer
item.description: Check out the Finish 'Em Trailer for Persona 5 Royal, the enhanced re-release of P5, a JRPG game developed by Atlus.

item.title: Fallout 76: Super Mutant Locations
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Are Super Mutants In Fallout 76?
  • Super Mutant Locations

Fallout 76 is Bethesda's take on an online Fallout game, and it is a pretty amazing game. While it may have had a rocky start, players have been flocking back to the game ever since the release of the Fallout TV show.

While playing the game, players may be asked to kill Super Mutants. These are a type of enemy that can be found all over Appalachia. Here is a guide to finding these Super Mutants in the game and defeating them.

What Are Super Mutants In Fallout 76?

Super Mutants are people who have been infected with the FEV (Forced Evolutionary Virus). While they may seem like a side effect of the nuclear fallout that has destroyed America since the Great War, they are actually creatures that were created before the war. Unfortunately, they are the product of the corrupt science experiments that many companies were running around the country. The Super Mutants in Appalachia came to be after a local facility contaminated water that ran through the bulk of the region, causing anyone who was unlucky enough to come into contact with the water to develop the FEV.

The Super Mutants in Fallout 76 come in a variety of variants. Each of these types of Super Mutants are able to do specific things and will have certain weapon types equipped. They are the following:

  • Super Mutant Beserker
  • Super Mutant Brute
  • Super Mutant Butcher
  • Super Mutant Champion
  • Super Mutant Demolisher
  • Super Mutant Enforcer
  • Super Mutant Fighter
  • Super Mutant Firestarter
  • Super Mutant Gladiator
  • Super Mutant Master
  • Super Mutant Overlord
  • Super Mutant Pillager
  • Super Mutant Primus
  • Super Mutant Skirmisher
  • Super Mutant Suicider
  • Super Mutant Warlord

Super Mutant Locations

While Super Mutants can be found in various places at times (like Harpers Ferry or Summersville), there are also places where they can always be found. There are actually quite a few places that will always have these enemies, as they will always travel around in packs. One important thing to note is that while Super Mutants are tough enemies on their own, they also have Super Mutant Hounds that can cause damage to the player. Here are all the locations where Super Mutants are always going to spawn.

  • Abandoned Bog Town
  • Bolton Greens
  • Charleston
  • Crevasse Dam
  • Eastern Regional Penitentiary
  • Grafton
  • Grafton Dam
  • Grafton Steel
  • Horizon's Rest
  • Huntersville
  • National Isolated Radio Array
  • New Gad
  • Nicholson's End
  • North Kanawha Lookout
  • The General's Steakhouse
  • West Tek Research Center

item.title: Dead Island 2: How To Beat Becki The Bride (Boss Fight)
item.description:
Becki the Bride is the first boss players encounter in Dead Island 2 , introducing players to some of the game's toughest enemies in the Zompedia. Dead Island 2 's Becki the Bride is a hilarious twist on the Bridezilla mentality as players get to 'dance with the bride' on a wedding party dance floor and defeat the intimidating, gruesome boss.

Becki the Bride is also the first time players begin defeating Dead Island 2 's crushers, a tank zombie with powerful attacks that can catch some players off-guard. Becki appears toward the end of the ' Room Service for Major Booker ' story mission in the Halperin Hotel. Fortunately, with a few handy boss fight tips, defeating Becki is a breeze.

Updated June 1st, 2024, by Michael Llewellyn: Becki the Bride is a powerful boss character who is challenging to damage, and it seems like the character doesn't ever flinch. Worse still, other zombies join in the attack, making life more difficult for the player. Thankfully, defeating her is a matter of timing and staying on the move. This guide has been updated with more tips to fight Becki's zombie attackers, and another method to stagger and damage the Bride's stability bar.

How to Beat Becki The Bride In Dead Island 2

Defeating Becki the Bride is a bit of a grind. However, there are some key strategies and techniques to beat Becki as fast as possible:

Learn To Block

Learning how to block in Dead Island 2 is crucial to beating Becki. Blocking helps protect players from losing health too quickly, but a well-timed block is essential to win the fight. If players time their block just as Becki hits, they can temporarily stun her. This technique gives players a small window of opportunity to hit Becki with a powerful melee weapon and unleash critical damage. Becki will stagger backward after landing a successful parry , so attack her head for critical damage.

Repeating this strategy also causes Becki to drop to her knees, damaging her stability and enabling players to get up close and cause more damage when she's vulnerable , as the UI states. This technique also comes in handy for defeating other crushers that appear as the game progresses.

Use Nearby Healing Supplies

Players may also want to take note of the locations of Dead Island 2 's healing items around the room, like med kits, protein bars, and energy drinks. There's plenty located on the sides of the dance floor and on top of the 'Mrs' letters on the stage. Grab the Med Kits - but keep the protein bars for the battle - before activating the radio to begin the battle, or know where to look if health gets critical.

Don't Get Surrounded

After depleting Becki's stability bar she will drop to her knees, triggering a wave of regular zombies to start attacking the protagonist. Avoid getting surrounded by running to the opposite side of the dancefloor. Use the running dropkick to knock them down and cut them down with a weapon to finish them off. Some zombies can randomly drop medkits , but keep an eye on Becki. Use Chem Bombs for an area-of-attack effect on Becki and the smaller zombies to slow them down. Becki's team of zombies will often get caught in her shockwave attack so players should use that to their advantage, as a downed zombie can be vulnerable to a finishing stomp attack for more EXP.

Jump To Avoid Becki's Ground Pound

As well as kicking or swiping, Becki attacks by jumping in the air and pounding the ground in a stomp that unleashes a shockwave attack which can knock the player down if they're standing inside the AoE. Jumping to avoid the shockwave is the best method of preventing damage, because they can follow up with a kick to stagger Becki and damage her stability bar.

After depleting Becki's stability bar for the first time, she will use a double shockwave attack. Jump twice or hold the block button and counter with a kick or a dropkick to stagger her.

Choose A Powerful Weapon Mod Or Experiment With Environmental Kills

Ideally, players may want to choose a powerful weapon that doesn't overly drain stamina, especially when other zombies start to join the party. However, melee weapons like the machete modified with Dead Island 2 's Electrocutor mod can effectively inflict additional electricity damage

Players who want to liven up the party even more can try causing electricity damage with the overhanging electricity cable by luring Becki, or using the nearby jerry cans, to form an electric puddle trap, or the fuel cans to make a similar fiery death trap. Players can also throw a weapon at the overhanging lights to turn them into falling electric projectiles.

Reward For Defeating Becki The Bride

On defeating Becki, players unlock the War Cry skill card. The War Cry skill is a special attack triggered with the LB + RB on Xbox or L1 + R2 on PlayStation. It allows the player to use a yell that boosts their toughness and nearby squadmates, and weakens zombies. It's an excellent skill to fight the Crusher enemies, who are similar in size to Becki, as it creates a window of attack and slows down the regular enemies the player will bump into on their way back to Bel Air.

item.title: Iconic Counter-Strike Map Recreated in Call of Duty Zombies
item.description:
Highlights

  • A fan recreated Counter-Strike's Mirage map in Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 Zombies using great modding tools on PC.
  • Mirage, a classic Counter-Strike map, works surprisingly well in the Call of Duty Zombies mode due to its good map design.
  • The fan-made map features weapon purchase spots and Perk-a-Cola machines, blurring the line between two great FPS franchises.

A Call of Duty Zombies fan online has shared footage of an awesome remake of Counter-Strike 's iconic map, Mirage, in the Black Ops 3 version of the mode. Call of Duty Zombies has had plenty of new maps over the years, but this fan-made map blurs the line between two great FPS franchises.

The mod in question is built on the Black Ops 3 version of Call of Duty Zombies . Thanks to great modding tools on the PC edition, Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 features plenty of amazing mods, both in Zombies and in the other game modes. Some Call of Duty fans were even remastering Modern Warfare 2 's multiplayer in Black Ops 3 , although this project was a little while ago now. It has been interesting to see over the years how players have used these mod tools to bring their ideas to life, and this latest Counter-Strike creation is among the coolest yet.

The remake of Counter-Strike 's Mirage is available on Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 's Steam Workshop, although footage of it in action was posted to Twitter by user Faders_. The map is structured exactly as it is in Counter-Strike , but features plenty of added details to make it feel just like an authentic Call of Duty Zombies map. Weapon purchase spots have been placed around Mirage, and Call of Duty Zombies Perk-a-Cola machines can be found in various spots. Mirage may not have initially been designed as a Call of Duty Zombies map, but it certainly works well as one.

Counter-Strike's Mirage Recreated in Call of Duty Zombies

Mirage has been a huge Counter-Strike staple for over a decade now. It was first added to CS:GO in 2013, and since its arrival, it has not been removed from the competitive map pool a single time. It truly is one of the best Counter-Strike maps of all time, which is why it's such a surprise that it works so well even when translated to another game. Good map design is good map design, no matter where it's applied, it

Although it's great to see players continuing to enjoy old versions of Call of Duty Zombies , it will be interesting to see what Treyarch cooks up for the Black Ops 6 iteration of the mode. Some feel that the trailer for the game has set up the possibility of a Five-style Call of Duty Zombies map in Black Ops 6 , but the developer is yet to officially reveal what's coming next for the mode. As the first mainline Treyarch Call of Duty title since 2020, the expectations are sure to be high.

item.title: Original Pokemon Anime Created a Problem That Still Hasn't Been Resolved
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon lore remains disjointed despite the property's success, leaving unanswered questions for fans to debate and theorize about. For example, a fan recently pointed out that the anime contains an acquarium with real fish.
  • Game Freak's early choices in the Pokemon anime may have been due to limited options for water-types, sparking discussions on the franchise's evolution.

A fan has highlighted a plothole from an early episode of the Pokemon anime that has yet to be addressed. Despite being one of the most successful entertainment franchises in the world, the Pokemon games had humble beginnings, with the first game being set on an alternative version of Earth.

The lore throughout the Pokemon franchise can be disjointed, with each new generation raising questions about both the games and anime. An example of this can be seen with the planet itself, as players still dont know what the world of Pokemon looks like, or where each region is located compared to the others. One fan has recently discovered an unanswered question dating back to the early days of the Pokemon anime.

A Reddit user named Rychu_SR has posted a screenshot from the early days of the Pokemon anime highlighting an aquarium showcasing real-world fish instead of Pokemon. At the time of writing, the post has garnered 3.4k upvotes and has sparked a debate among the Pokemon community. The comments in the thread acknowledge that Game Freak only had a pool of 151 monsters to draw from, so it wouldnt make sense to populate the aquarium with the limited numbers of Water-type Pokemon such as Magikarp and Goldeen, unless they were to be incorporated into future games.

Pokemon Fan Highlights An Unanswered Question From The Pokemon Anime

This line of debate may be the most logical approach, with some fans referencing entries in the Kanto Pokedex to further substantiate the theory. One fan notes that the Pokemon FireRed entry for Raichu tells players that the Pokemon has enough energy to make an Indian Elephant faint. This description is later changed in Pokemon Legends: Arcues to reference Copperajah, a Steel-type elephant introduced in Generation 8.

It could be argued that Game Freak didnt expect the Pokemon franchise to take off in the way it did and didnt fully commit to its unique lore. As time has progressed and more Pokemon have been added to the world, the lore of Pokemon has become more fleshed out and now includes references to Pokemon being responsible for all aspects of daily life, including the creation of a multiverse.

As the Pokemon franchise continues to evolve, this does mean that older games and anime episodes like the one Rychu_SR pointed out become odd relics. It remains to be seen if future games like Pokemon Legends Z-A will fit in with the established story or attempt to retcon any outdated information.
